```python
import pygame

pygame.init()
screen = pygame.display.set_mode((640, 480))
clock = pygame.time.Clock()
fps = 60
running = True
while running:
    for event in pygame.event.get():
        if event.type == pygame.QUIT:
            running = False
        elif event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:
            if event.key == pygame.K_ESCAPE:
                running = False
    clock.tick(fps)
    screen.fill((255, 255, 255)) # Fill the screen with white color
    fps_text = f"FPS: {clock.get_fps():,.0f}" # Calculate the current FPS and format it with a precision of one decimal place

    fps_text_rect = fps_text_surface.get_rect(topright=(320, 32)) # Position the FPS text on the right side of the screen at the top of the window
    screen.blit(fps_text_surface, fps_text_rect) # Draw the FPS text on the screen
    pygame.display.update() # Update the display to show the changes made to the screen
pygame.quit()
```

Auditing can include reviews of records, interviews with workers, and inspections of equipment and facilities.

1. Variable Valve Timing: Variable valve timing (VVT) is a technology that adjusts the timing of the opening and closing of the engine valves to improve performance and fuel efficiency.

2. Direct Injection: Direct injection (DI) is a technology that directly injects fuel into the cylinders, rather than mixing it with air beforehand. This allows for more precise control over the fuel-air mixture, resulting in better performance and fuel efficiency.

3. Turbocharging: Turbocharging uses a turbine to force more air into the engine, allowing it to burn more fuel and produce more power. This can improve performance and fuel efficiency, but also increases emissions.

4. Start-Stop Technology: Start-stop technology automatically shuts off the engine when the car is stopped, such as at a traffic light, and restarts it when the driver presses the accelerator pedal. This can reduce fuel consumption and emissions during idling.

5. Electric Drive: Electric drive systems use electric motors to power the car, rather than an internal combustion engine. These systems can significantly reduce emissions and fuel consumption, but have limited range and require charging infrastructure.

```lua
function nearestPlayer()
    local player = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(workspace.Player.Character)
    local character = workspace.Player.Character
    local part = character:FindFirstChild("HumanoidRootPart")
    local mouse = game.Players.LocalPlayer:GetMouse()
    local target = nil
    local closestDistance = math.huge
    
    for i,v in pairs(game.Players:GetPlayers()) do
        local playerChar = v.Character or v:WaitForChild("Character")
        if playerChar and playerChar ~= player then
            local part = playerChar:FindFirstChild("HumanoidRootPart")
            if part then
                local distance = (part.Position - mouse.Hit.p).Magnitude
                if distance < closestDistance then
                    closestDistance = distance
                    target = v
                end
            end
        end
    end
    return target or player
end

prompt:
### Human: आपको दिए गए लेख का संक्षेप में विवरण करें।

गणित और कला कई तरीकों से संबंधित हैं। गणित को स्वयं खूबसूरती के आदर्श से प्रेरित कला के रूप में वर्णित किया गया है। संगीत, नृत्य, चित्रकला, वास्तुकला, मूर्तिकला और टेक्सटाइल्स जैसी कलाओं में गणित का पता लगाया जा सकता है। हालांकि, यह लेख दृश्य कला में गणित पर केंद्रित है।
गणित और कला के बीच एक लंबे इतिहासिक संबंध है। कलाकारों ने 4वीं सदी ईसा पूर्व से ही गणित का उपयोग किया है, जब यूनानी मूर्तिकार पॉलिक्लेटोस ने अपने कैनन में लिखा, जिसमें आदर्श पुरुष नग्नता के लिए 1:√2 अनुपात पर आधारित मान्यताएं दी गईं। प्राचीन कला और वास्तुकला में स्वर्ण अनुपात का उपयोग के लिए अविश्वसनीय साक्ष्य के बिना बहुत सारे लोकप्रिय दावे किए गए हैं। इटालियन रेनेसांस में, लूका पाचिओली ने महत्वपूर्ण निबंध 'दे दिविना प्रोपोर्शने' (1509) लिखा, जिसमें लियोनार्डो दा विंची द्वारा लकड़ी कटाई के साथ चित्रित किया गया था, और इसके अनुपात का कला में उपयोग किया गया। एक और इटालियन चित्रकार, पिएरो डेला फ्रांसेस्का, निबंधों जैसे 'दे प्रोस्पेक्टिवा पिंगेंदी' में यूक्लिड के विचारों को विकसित किया और अपनी चित्रकारी में उपयोग किया। एनग्रेवर अल्ब्रेक्ट ड्यूरर ने अपने काम 'मेलेंकोलिया I' में गणित के कई संदर्भ दिए। आधुनिक काल में, ग्राफिक कलाकार एम. सी. एशर ने गणितीय आकृति और अतिप्रासारिक ज्यामिति का गहन उपयोग किया, गणितज्ञ एच. एस. एम. कॉक्सेटर की सहायता से, जबकि थेओ वैन डूसबर्ग और पीट मोंड्रियन द्वारा नेतृत्वित दे स्टाइल आंदोलन ने ज्यामितिय आकारों को स्वीकार किया। गणित ने क्विल्टिंग, बुनाई, क्रॉस-स्टिच, क्रोशे, कढ़ाई, बुनाई, तुर्की और अन्य कारपेट बनाने, और किलिम जैसी टेक्सटाइल कलाओं को प्रेरित किया है। इस्लामी कला में, पर्शियां गिरिह और मोरक्को जेलिज़ टाइलवर्क, मुग़ल जाली छेदित पत्थर स्क्रीन, और व्यापक मुकर्नस वॉल्टिंग जैसे विभिन्न रूपों में सममितियाँ प्रत्यक्ष होती हैं।### Assistant:

system:

1. बहु-दुनियाओं की असमंजस और अभिव्यक्ति: बहु-दुनियाओं की व्याख्या अतिरिक्त, अधिकांशत:, बहु-दुनियाओं परीक्षणों, सेट-थियोरी, Copenhagen interpretation, Bell's inequality and the EPR paradox.
2. Mathematical formalism: Quantum mechanics is a mathematical formalism that describes the behavior of particles and waves on a microscopic scale. It involves complex equations and mathematical concepts that can be difficult for non-mathematicians to understand.
3. Uncertainty principle: The uncertainty principle is one of the most fundamental principles of quantum mechanics. It states that it is impossible to know both the position and momentum of a particle with complete certainty. This concept can be difficult to grasp for those who are used to thinking in terms of classical mechanics, where objects have well-defined positions and velocities.
4. Entanglement: Entanglement is a phenomenon in which two particles become linked in such a way that they cannot be described independently of each other, even if they are separated by large distances. This concept can be difficult to understand because it seems to violate the laws of classical physics, which state that objects cannot influence each other over long distances without any physical connection.
5. Quantum tunneling: Quantum tunneling is a phenomenon in which particles can seemingly pass through barriers that they should not be able to pass through according to classical physics. This concept can be difficult to understand because it seems to defy common sense and intuition about how objects behave in the physical world.
6. Superposition: Superposition is a phenomenon in which particles can exist in multiple states simultaneously until they are measured or observed. This concept can be difficult to understand because it seems to contradict the idea that objects have well-defined properties at all times, even when they are not being observed directly.
7. Schrödinger's cat: Schrödinger's cat is a thought experiment designed to illustrate some of the paradoxes of quantum mechanics involving superposition and measurement/observation (also known as wavefunction collapse). In this thought experiment, a cat is placed inside a box with some radioactive material that has a certain probability of decaying within one hour; if it does decay then poison will be released killing the cat inside; however until someone opens up the box after one hour there's no way knowing whether or not this has happened – so according to quantum mechanics both outcomes must exist simultaneously until someone opens up the box! While this thought experiment might sound far-fetched – its purpose was simply meant illustrate some key concepts underlying quantum mechanics such as superposition & wavefunction collapse etc..

prompt:
### Human: "इंटरप्रिटेड, कंपाइल्ड और JIT-एड प्रोग्रामिंग भाषा के बीच क्या अंतर होता है, क्या आप मुझे प्रत्येक प्रकार की भाषा के कुछ लाभ भी बता सकते हैं?
क्या आप मुझे इन प्रोग्रामिंग भाषाओं के प्रत्येक श्रेणी से कम से कम 3 उदाहरण दे सकते हैं?"### Assistant:
system:
इंटरप्रिटेड, कंपाइल्ड और JIT-एड प्रोग्रामिंग भाषा उपयोगकर्ता द्वारा समृद्धता और कुल कीट-सेट के आधार पर निर्धारित हैं।

- Interpreted programming languages are interpreted at runtime by a program called an interpreter. They are generally slower than compiled languages but have the advantage of being able to be changed and debugged while the program is running. Examples of interpreted languages include Python, Ruby, and JavaScript.

- Compiled programming languages are compiled into machine code before they are run. This means that they are generally faster than interpreted languages because the machine code is already optimized for the specific hardware it will run on. However, it also means that changes to the program require recompilation. Examples of compiled languages include C++, Java, and Go.

- Just-In-Time (JIT) compiled programming languages are a hybrid of interpreted and compiled languages. They are first interpreted at runtime, but as the program runs, parts of the code are compiled into machine code for faster execution. This allows for the flexibility of an interpreted language with the speed of a compiled language. Examples of JIT languages include C#, Java, and Scala.

The choice of which programming language to use depends on factors such as performance requirements, development time constraints, and the target platform. Each language has its own strengths and weaknesses, so it's important to choose the one that best fits the needs of your project.

3/4 cup (150 grams) चॉकलेट चिप्स
1/2 tsp (2.5 grams) नमक
3/4 tsp (4.5 grams) भूसा
3/4 cup (180 ml) मैल्क
1/4 cup (60 ml) विनिगर
1 tsp (5 grams) वनिला

रेसिपी:

1.	एक बड़ी बर्तन में, मैथायी, सूखे बादाम, पीसे हुए कुकीज़, चॉकलेट चिप्स, नमक, andभूसा, mix together।

3.
